meanings.definition: To crush or squeeze something into a flat shape
meanings.sent1: She smushes the playdough into a pancake.
meanings.sent2: He always smushes his sandwich before eating it.
meanings.sent3: The cat smushes itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The heavy book smushes the delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The chef smushes the garlic to release its flavor.

meanings.definition: To press or push something together
meanings.sent1: Mom smushes the clothes into the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: The child smushes the clay between their fingers.
meanings.sent3: The puppy smushes its face against the window.
meanings.sent4: The crowd smushes together to get a better view.
meanings.sent5: The hug smushes us close in warmth.

meanings.definition: To combine or mix things together closely
meanings.sent1: She smushes the colors together to make a new shade.
meanings.sent2: The chef smushes the ingredients to create a sauce.
meanings.sent3: The siblings smush their toys into one big pile.
meanings.sent4: The artist smushes different textures in their painting.
meanings.sent5: The music smushes genres for a unique sound.
